about.description:
FindImports extracts Python module dependencies by parsing source files. It
can report names that are imported but not used, and it can generate module
import graphs in ASCII or graphviz formats.

FindImports extracts Python module dependencies by parsing source files. It
can report names that are imported but not used, and it can generate module
import graphs in ASCII or graphviz formats.

name: findimports
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "findimports" %}
{% set version = "2.3.0" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.io/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/{{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 8247458f800cbad659d42b725be2c11ce475c34a423f7da8ccfe90f1daa82dff

build:
  noarch: python
  number: 0
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv

requirements:
  host:
    - python >=3.6
    - pip
  run:
    - python >=3.6

test:
  imports:
    - findimports
  commands:
    - findimports -h

about:
  home: https://github.com/mgedmin/findimports
  license: GPL-2.0-or-later
  license_family: GPL
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: Python module import analysis tool

  # The remaining entries in this section are optional, but recommended.
  description: |
    FindImports extracts Python module dependencies by parsing source files. It
    can report names that are imported but not used, and it can generate module
    import graphs in ASCII or graphviz formats.
  dev_url: https://github.com/mgedmin/findimports

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - moorepants
